title: Establish a blaseRtemplates Installation
text: goals blaseRtemplates : establish encapsulated computing environment data analysis R. improve upon existing methods installing software packages maintaining version control provide useful template scripts setting projects, working git, common, repetitive tasks. result, hope, reduced system footprint (storage), faster package installation times, better reproducibility overall improved user experience.

New versions 0.0.0.0125 onward implemented new cache structure. cacheing approach similar renv. However system reconciliation versions much straightforward. addition, default starting new project, automatically latest versions packages available . project-specific libraries symlinked main cache save disk space. See minimal examples

title: Generates a structured R project with custom templates.
text: Edit .Renvironment file set blaseRtemplates cache. system administrator, edit Renviron.site file: set blaseRtemplates cache folder tell pak cache source files. run: Restart R.
code: BLASERTEMPLATES_CACHE_ROOT=<a convenient directory> R_PKG_CACHE_DIR=<same as BLASERTEMPLATES_CACHE_ROOT>/pkgcache dir.create(file.path(<same as BLASERTEMPLATES_CACHE_ROOT>, "library"))

title: Generates a structured R project with custom templates.
text: install single package: can find human-readable table packages cache BLASERTEMPLATES_CACHE_ROOT/package_catalog.tsv. Use trick install long list packages may using: code install list packages capture error messages fail install. Uninstalled give package names. likley going base packages distributed CRAN don’t need cahce packages non-standard repositories local source files install manually.
code: # install a new package or get the latest version from a repository  blaseRtemplates::install_one_package(package = "<package_name>", how = "new_or_update")  # get a fresh link to the newest version available in the cache  blaseRtemplates::install_one_package(package = "<package_name>", how = "link_from_cache")  # get a specific version in the cache  blaseRtemplates::install_one_package(package = "<package_name>", how = "link_from_cache", which_version = "1.0.0.") packages_to_install <- c(<vector of package names>)  safely_install <- purrr::safely(blaseRtemplates::install_one_package)    installation <- purrr::map(   .x = packages_to_install,   .f = \(x) safely_install(x, how = "new_or_update")   )  transposed_installation <- purrr::transpose(installation)  uninstalled <- purrr::map2_chr(.x = transposed_installation$error,             .y = packages_to_install,             .f = \(x, y) {               if (!is.null(x)) {                 return(y)               } else {                 return("ok")               }             } ) uninstalled <- uninstalled[uninstalled != "ok"]

Say, however, collaborating project. Another person may using different set packages. can circumstances change output. adopt package library used different individual, supply argument get_new_library(). files created structured way; files always named _.tsv. Therefore never cause git conflicts. can use simple anti_join preview differences two project library catalogs.
code: blaseRtemplates::get_new_library() blaseRtemplates::get_new_library("other_user_projet.tsv") my_lib <- readr::read_tsv() their_lib <- readr::read_tsv() anti_join(my_lib, their_lib, by = c("name", "version")))
